intro: Adesmia calycicomosa, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant features compound leaves and produces vibrant yellow-orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its seed pods are typically hairy and contain several seeds. Adesmia calycicomosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in a variety of soil types with adequate sunlight.
